name: Croatia
description: Croatia, a captivating country situated on the Adriatic Sea, boasts a rich history, stunning coastline, and diverse landscapes ranging from rugged mountains to rolling hills and picturesque islands. Known for its vibrant culture, delicious cuisine, and welcoming people, Croatia offers a unique blend of experiences for travelers seeking adventure, relaxation, and cultural immersion.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Croatia is a relatively small country, but incredibly diverse in its geography.
quickFacts.detail: It encompasses mainland Croatia, numerous islands, and the coastline of several neighboring countries.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Croatia has a steadily growing population.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides along the coast and in major cities like Zagreb and Split.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Zagreb is the political, economic, and cultural center of Croatia.
quickFacts.detail: It's a charming city with a well-preserved historic center and numerous museums and galleries.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Croatian is a South Slavic language.
quickFacts.detail: It's closely related to Serbian and Bosnian.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Prior to this, the Croatian Kuna (HRK) was used.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Tourism is a major contributor to the country's GDP.

climateData.title: Mediterranean Climate
climateData.description: Croatia enjoys a predominantly Mediterranean climate, characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The coastal regions experience a sea breeze that moderates temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Long, sunny days and warm temperatures make this the peak tourist season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds make autumn a great time to visit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cool and wet winters with occasional snowfall, particularly in mountainous regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures gradually rise, and wildflowers bloom across the countryside.

naturalWonders.name: Plitvice Lakes National Park
naturalWonders.description: Plitvice Lakes is a UNESCO World Heritage site renowned for its sixteen interconnected lakes, cascading waterfalls, and lush forests. The turquoise waters and stunning scenery create a truly magical experience.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lakes are fed by underground springs and flow into a series of waterfalls that cascade into the next lake. The park is a haven for diverse flora and fauna, including numerous bird species.

naturalWonders.name: Krka National Park
naturalWonders.description: Krka National Park is famous for its stunning waterfalls and clear, turquoise rivers. The park offers a variety of hiking trails and opportunities for swimming and relaxation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Roski Waterfall is the most iconic feature of the park, but there are numerous other waterfalls and pools to explore. The park is also home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including rare bird species.
viewingTips: Take a boat trip to explore the waterfalls

naturalWonders.name: Velebit Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The Velebit Mountains stretch along the Dinaric Alps, offering dramatic landscapes, diverse ecosystems, and challenging hiking trails.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountains are characterized by limestone peaks, deep canyons, and numerous caves. The Velebit Nature Park protects a significant portion of the mountain range, preserving its biodiversity and natural beauty.
viewingTips: Be prepared for changing weather conditions

biodiversityCategory.name: Mediterranean Flora
biodiversityCategory.description: The Mediterranean region is renowned for its unique and diverse flora, adapted to the hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.

statistics.details: Many plant species are found only in Croatia.
Several plant species are listed as threatened or endangered.

notableSpecies.name: Maquis shrubland
notableSpecies.significance: Dominant vegetation type in coastal areas.

notableSpecies.name: Croatian Cypress
notableSpecies.significance: A unique species found only in Croatia.

ecosystemData.title: Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Croatia's coastline is a complex and dynamic ecosystem, characterized by diverse habitats including rocky shores, sandy beaches, and seagrass meadows.

biodiversityCategories.name: Seagrass Meadows
biodiversityCategories.description: Seagrass meadows provide vital habitat for a variety of marine species and help to protect the coastline from erosion.

statistics.details: Croatia has extensive seagrass meadows along its coastline.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rocky Shores
biodiversityCategories.description: Rocky shores are home to a diverse community of invertebrates, algae, and fish.

statistics.details: Rocky shores dominate a significant portion of the Croatian coastline.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Croatia
activities.description: Croatia offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Croatia's stunning mountains, forests, and coastal trails.

activities.name: Coastal Hiking
activities.description: Hike along the scenic coastline, enjoying breathtaking views of the Adriatic Sea.

activities.name: Mountain Hiking
activities.description: Challenge yourself with a hike in the Velebit Mountains or other mountain ranges.
safety: Be prepared for changing weather conditions

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Croatia's crystal-clear waters.

activities.name: Swimming
activities.description: Relax and swim in the Adriatic Sea.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Explore the underwater world of Croatia's coastline.
